title: Mathematical Modeling and Deep Learning Applications for Multimodal Image Restoration and Fusion

context.prior_knowledge: Linear algebra, basic deep learning concepts, and fundamentals of image processing
context.additional_context: A specialized training program for engineers currently analyzing multimodal medical/satellite images in their workflows.

learning_goals: Learners can formalize multimodal image restoration problems as mathematical optimization models.
Learners can understand convolutional sparse coding principles and apply them to image fusion problems.
Learners can comparatively analyze the strengths and weaknesses of deep learning-based solutions and traditional optimization techniques.
Learners can design image processing network architectures using the Method of Multipliers (MM).
Learners can implement restoration/fusion algorithms on real-world industrial image data and evaluate their performance.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
